intro: Tristellateia novaeguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea star lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant features strap-like, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of fragrant blooms during the wet season. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its unique appearance and adaptability to humid conditions.
